uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.action

Class FormAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.action.FormAction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddFieldTransition.AddFieldAction, ChainAction, CreateAction, DeleteAction, DisabledAction, DomTransitionProvider.EditAction, DomTransitionProvider.EditNodeAction, DropFieldTransition.DropAction, DropForeignKeyTransition.DropAction, DropIndexTransition.DropAction, DynamicFormTransitionProvider.AddXMLTransition.XMLUploadAction, DynamicFormTransitionProvider.DuplicateTransition.DuplicateAction, EmailChangeRequestFactory.RequestAction, EmailTransitionProvider.EditFormAction, ErrorProcessingFormAction, LogFactory.ItemAction, MoveDateTransition.MoveDateAction, NestAction, PartManager.ChildCreateAction, PartPathTransitionProvider.AddXMLTransition.XMLUploadAction, PartPathTransitionProvider.ConfigTransition.ConfigAction, PartPathTransitionProvider.EditPartTransition.CancelAction, PasswordUpdateFormBuilder.CancelAction, PasswordUpdateFormBuilder.UpdateAction, PersonalResponseTransitionProvider.CreateTransition.ViewAction, PreferenceTransitionProvider.SetFeatureTransition.SetFeatureAction, PreferenceTransitionProvider.SetPreferenceTransition.SetAction, RelationshipTableCreator.CreateAction, ResponseTransitionProvider.EditSectionTransition.CancelAction, RetireAction, RoleUpdate.RoleAction, SplitTransition.SplitAction, TableSpecificationTransitionSource.AddIndexAction, TextFileOverlay.TextFileRevertAction, TextFileOverlay.TextFileUpdateAction, UnRetireAction, UpdateAction, XMLOverlay.XMLEditAction

    public abstract class FormAction
extends java.lang.Object
    A formAction represents an action button attached to a form When the button is pressed. Actions can request a yes/no confirm message. If validation is turned off then the state of the form is ignored and the action is run anyway. This is used to implement cancel actions.
    Author:
    spb

    • Method Detail

      • action

        public abstract FormResult action(Form f)
                           throws ActionException
        Perform the actual action based on the form parameters. Throw a TransitionException to show an error message to the user. or a ActionException to produce a generic error message.
        Throws:
        ActionException
        Parameters:
        f - Form
        Returns:
        FormResult

      • getConfirm

        public java.lang.String getConfirm(Form f)
        should this action be confirmed before execute If this returns null no confirm is required. If not null it is the name of the confirm message in the confirm.properties

        The form is passed to allow a sub-class to trigger confirm based on form parameters.

        Parameters:
        f - Form calling action.
        Returns:
        String confirm name

      • getConfirmArgs

        public java.lang.String[] getConfirmArgs(Form f)
        Method to supply arguments to a form confirmation.
        Parameters:
        f - Form calling action.
        Returns:
        null or arguement list

        Returns:
        String or null

      • getText

        public java.lang.Object getText()
        Get optional button content to use instead of the action name. This can be a UIProvider or UIGenerator but should not include active content
        Returns:
        Object to add

      • getShortcut

        public java.lang.String getShortcut()
